sentences.en: A climax was near and she would not sit idle.
sentences.cn: 危机已经迫在眉睫,她不会善罢甘休的.

sentences.en: But at this climax we were all together.
sentences.cn: 但是,在这最紧要的关头,我们是同舟共济的.

sentences.en: For Pritchard, reaching an Olympics was the climax of her career.
sentences.cn: 对普里查德来说，参加奥运会是她事业上的巅峰。

sentences.en: His election to the presidency was the climax of his career.
sentences.cn: 他当选为总统是他职业生涯的顶峰.

sentences.en: In some climax communities, there is slow accumulation of net ecosystem production.
sentences.cn: 某些顶极群落中也存在缓慢积累的净生态系统生产.

sentences.en: In the climax of the display the heavens seem on fire.
sentences.cn: 在最精彩的一幕中,天空好象在燃烧.

sentences.en: In this life - or - death climax, he showed himself a terrible personality.
sentences.cn: 在这个生死关头, 他表现出一种令人惧怕的性格.

sentences.en: It was the climax to 24 hours of growing anxiety.
sentences.cn: 24小时里不断加重的焦虑在那一刻达到顶点。

sentences.en: Lambing is the climax of the sheep farmer's year.
sentences.cn: 一年之中，产羔期最令羊农高兴。

sentences.en: The air war over Europe was reaching its climax.
sentences.cn: 欧洲的空战已近白热化.

sentences.en: The business in hand was approaching some kind of climax.
sentences.cn: 手头的生意似乎快到紧要关头了。

sentences.en: the climax of his naval career
The climax of Negro entertainment was reached in the 1930 s.
sentences.cn: 黑人剧到了20世纪30年代才发展到顶点.

sentences.en: The climax of this work was the development of trigonometry.
sentences.cn: 三角术的发展是这项工作的高峰.

sentences.en: The festival reaches its climax with the traditional boat-burning ceremony.
sentences.cn: 传统的烧船仪式将节庆活动推向了高潮。

sentences.en: The last golf tournament of the European season is building up to a dramatic climax.
sentences.cn: 欧洲赛季的最后一场高尔夫球锦标赛就要迎来最激动人心的时刻。

sentences.en: Their argument was brought to a climax.

words.tran_cn: 高潮的；顶点的；渐层法的

phrases.tran_cn: 顶极群落（在不受骚扰的情况下能生长的所有植物）

trans.tran_en: the most exciting or important part of a story or experience, which usually comes near the end
if a situation, process, or story climaxes, it reaches its most important or exciting part
